main event: A civilian reported seeing an unidentified flying object (UFO) in Fairborn, Ohio on 16 July 1951.
interesting points: The object was described as bluish-white in color and exhibited extreme altitude, moving from side to side similar to free balloons with no sound.
The civilian's observation lasted approximately 5 minutes, and the object was evaluated as a balloon based on its movement.
The object was initially mistaken for a star due to its size and characteristics but was then observed to move at extreme speed from a standing position.
The UFO's movement, including hovering and dimming as it entered a haze, was detailed, with estimated dimensions of 100 to 150 feet in diameter and an altitude of 1600 to 2000 feet.
The object's unorthodox movements and lack of sound, along with its Southeast direction, were noted as inconsistent with any known airplane.
